version_description:
UPDATE: Fixed iPod 5G voice quality.
UPDATE: Fixed iPhone 4S, iPad 2 and iPad Mini voice quality.

- For those late night under-the-covers chat sessions, dark theme is now available.
- Embeds are now smaller and less annoying. 
- Engineers rejoice - code blocks and inline code work on mobile. 
- Mentions on mobile now highlight themselves. Helps cut through the noise, like a digital machete.
- When tapped, unread messages banner will now bring you on a magical journey to find your long lost messages.
- Added an indicator to show your active server. Get lost less! 
- The app loads faster now. So fast, that it blew these words over with its speed. Whooooosh.
- Messages are now optimistic and drink out of mugs that say “You go, girl.”
- Added a placeholder image for avatars while they’re hiding.
- Fixed weird drawer positioning with in-call status bar because feng shui.
- Fixed sucky crashes when disconnecting from voice channel.
- Fixed suckier logout crashes. 
- Drawers dragging sensitivity issues fixed. No more cry-baby drawers here.
- Fixed duplicate duplicate messages messages.
- Fixed @mention not highlighting while sending a message.
- Camera now takes full-resolution photos. Keepin’ it HD, baby.

UPDATE: iPad App with fancy things!
UPDATE: Mega performance improvements.

Check out all the goodies in this delivery:

- The iPad universal app is here! Now you can use Discord on those epic glass screens. ALSO LANDSCAPE.
- User interface performance has been improved by 20x. Tapping around should be extra tap-tastic.
- Battery drain has been substantially reduced, so you can stay up all night debating cats vs. dogs. 
- Split View works on iPads that support juggling fire and knives at the same time.
- Slideover support on iPad too! Woah! Keep your Discord only one swipe away.
- Twitch Custom Emojis now render properly inline. No more weird computer codes! 
- Apparently someone figured out how to make iOS apps crash by using a funky string. So we fixed that.
- The action sheet for editing messages used to hide behind the keyboard. We told it to stop. It begrudgingly agreed.
- Put a lid on an occasional hard crash when joining a server.

- Friendship is here! Add friends via email or username + #tag, block enemies, and experience the wumpus.
- User profiles have received a significantly regular overhaul. 
- Messages in a server from a user you've blocked will be hidden. Keep your eyes pure! 
- You can now tap highlighted messages to access profiles or channels. Context is power!

- Add support button which emails feedback to support@discordapp.com. Paging doctor Discord.

- Fixed a crash when trying to save account changes several times.

- Background audio will now continue to play alongside audio from Discord. I don’t know how you game AND talk AND listen to music, but now you can.
- Channel topics now render markdown correctly.
- Fixed when you banned a user and you didn’t ban a user. Usually you want a thing to do the thing, so we did the thing.
- Fixed the mutual friends in user profiles from loading indefinitely. 
- Fixed some spacing around navigational items for legibility and consistency AKA Shadi got annoyed by some pixels.
- Your own status is now visible in group DM member lists you egotistical #%$&.

NEW FEET
- If you synced your Battle.net, Steam, or Skype account on Discord’s desktop client, you’ll unlock a new suggested friends tab. 
- A user’s profile will now show their synced gaming accounts if enabled. Totally optional, we want to respect your private parts.
- User profiles got 163.95% sexier with a 3.2% margin of error.*
- User profiles now show notes so you can remember that one friend who went 2/15/0 on Zed and never, ever let him live that down Jared I’m looking at you, you scrub.
- You can now easily mention users by long pressing on their name and selecting “mention.” As Shakespeare once said, “the vigor of your touch on my name beckons me.”
- When reporting a user, we now ask you if you actually wanted to do that.

BUGS DELETE
- Fixed an “issue” where our baller ringtone would play by accident. I still don’t understand why we fixed this.
- Removed a rogue empty section header from the member list. It’s in timeout now.
- Fixed an issue with the way system messages looked in a blocked message because even when you’re not reading something we want it to look good.

*Prower, Miles T. "Sexiness of Discord User Profiles." International Journal of User Profile Sexiness 38.2 (2016): 420. BIGSTUDY. Web. 12 Sep. 2016.

New Stuffs
- Redesigned iOS Server Settings so you can now update more of the overview, integrations, security, invites, vanity url, and bans. You can also order a pizza, do your taxes, mass flag videos, and more. Role, channel, and member management coming soon!
- The member offline list now shows up to 100 people just like daddy desktop app. They grow up so fast :cry:
- You can now accept and ignore friend suggestions on iOS. Curate your friends!

Dead Bugs
- Push notifications now bring you where they are supposed to. All it took was some DW-40, my papi’s steel pliers, and the will of a thousand oxen.
- The app will no longer freeze when displaying lots of Twitch or custom emotes so feel free to spamalamadingdong.
- Long channel titles/usernames will now be restrained by the power of the Roman God Ellipses...

+ADDITIONS+
- You can now upload photos from any album on your photo, including such classics as Pictures of Ian Sleeping, My Trip to Denny’s, and that entire album of Shiba Inu photos you have.
- BONUS: You can add a comment when posting the image too. Check out the blanket Ian’s got this time.
- (edited) tag added to edited messages so you can see when someone’s hiding the truth.
- You can now manage and edit roles in server settings instead of not being able to manage and edit roles in server settings.

-SUBTRACTIONS-
- Custom emoji aren’t shy anymore and should now properly show up in autocomplete :TriHard:
- @everyone and @here should now show up properly in autocomplete within a group. Make sure you type your messages in all capital letters for maximum reach.

MASSIVE improvements to our voice tech. Your connections just got hella buffed.
- Watch our engineers Jesse and Andrei talk about the changes here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZiOUel0IZ0
- Dig a lil’ bit deeper with our blog post about these changes: https://blog.discordapp.com/we-care-about-your-voice-2/

We added some functionality!!!
- You can now directly upload GIFs and Videos for that motion picture juice.
- Added option to open links in Chrome or in-app browser. No option to open Ganon at this time, though. 
- That Zelda joke was horrible but great app would read change log again - 2/10 NGI
- We opened up a portal using Universal Links. Now, tapping on an invite link from ANYWHERE will open the app directly. 
- You can now move people between voice channels. Now you’re thinking with portals.

Your screens and menus are enhanced!!!
- Added webhook support and updated embed designs. Spiderman joke.
- New “Create Channel” screen. You can now set default role permissions too for your secret treehouse.
- New Kick and Ban screens. Banning now gives you the option to remove messages back a certain amount of days. What messages? Who? You’re crazy. You’re seeing things. Put the broom down. And get that bucket off your head. You’re not Russell Crowe. This is not Gladiator.
- *dodges broom strike* Improved the pop-out design when you tap someone.
- The GIF icon now properly displays on GIFs so you know they have the power to move.

Social:
- We have a Twitter! http://www.twitter.com/discordapp
- We have a Facebook! http://www.facebook.com/discordapp
- We have an Instagram! http://www.instagram.com/discordapp

MASSIVE improvements to our voice tech. Your connections just got hella buffed.
- Watch our engineers Jesse and Andrei talk about the changes here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZiOUel0IZ0
- Dig a lil’ bit deeper with our blog post about these changes: https://blog.discordapp.com/we-care-about-your-voice-2/

We added some functionality!!!
- You can now directly upload GIFs and Videos for that motion picture juice.
- Added option to open links in Chrome or in-app browser. No option to open Ganon at this time, though. 
- That Zelda joke was horrible but great app would read change log again - 2/10 NGI
- We opened up a portal using Universal Links. Now, tapping on an invite link from ANYWHERE will open the app directly. 
- You can now move people between voice channels. Now you’re thinking with portals.

Did you catch our 2017 teaser including Search, Video Chat, Screen Sharing, Audit Logs, and Channel Organization? Peep it at blog.discordapp.com.

That New iOS Hotness:

- You can now view your Recent Mentions and feel the disappointment when it was just an @everyone (you can filter those out though, after the initial sadness).
- You can now adjust pins and permissions on a per channel basis with ease and finesse. It’s like doing yoga with your fingers.
- Long press to pin a message. “Long Press” also sounds like a yoga pose. 
- You can also access channel settings from the server menu for an optimized and efficient approach. Keep lean.
- You can now transfer server ownership on mobile. FROM ONE LEADER TO THE NEXT, THY SERVER IS YOURS.
- Fixed text overflow in webhooks because we were running out of towels.

- Search on mobile is now complete: Now you don’t have to be at your computer to recall that obscure bit of info your buddy linked ten months ago. You can search for:
--- Who said what
--- When they said it
--- What channel they said it in
--- Liquid
--- If it had a video / image / embed
--- Who they mentioned
--- Liquid

- Sweet Nitro Perks: Carry your Nitro perks from desktop with you to the mobile app - Animate your avatar with GIF wizardry, use your server’s custom emotes anywhere in Discord, upload larger files, and see your Nitro-exclusive badge to prove that our love is real. 

- Even faster loading: We heard you guys had too much time to read the loading lines, so we turned some knobs and made Discord load even faster. Good luck reading them now.

- Channel Categories are live! Organize your server with categories! It’s like cleaning your room except a lot more fun and smells better.
- Makeover takeover: new log-in and 2FA screens, new look for the voice panel, ongoing call bar, DM/group call modal and new voice channel modal. We tryin’ to win that app beauty pageant please vote for us we can juggle.
- Channel and server settings are now 96.4% dark or white chocolate, depending on your dark/light theme choice. 
- You can now access privacy and safety settings on mobile. Customize your zone on your phone. 
- You can now have a different mobile theme setting than your desktop setting because some things really shouldn’t sync… like pineapple and pizza.
- You can now long press a channel to mark it as read, create an instant invite, or clone the channel (if you have permission). Usability at your heavily pressed fingertips!
- User profiles now display badges (like the Nitro badge) so you can swag your status and grow your ego on the go!
- Fixed a bug where the app would crash when too many unescaped characters are in a message. The characters won’t escape again.
- Fixed a crash when deleting a voice channel while on the connect to voice page. This is a good thing.

- It’s October, so you know what that means! New create and join server UI, obviously.
- Invite links no longer jump through web pages before bringing you inside the app. Less jank, more thank.
- The apparently newsworthy iOS 11 launch crash is now fixed.
- We’ve enabled HVM, or “Horizontal Viewing Mode” for videos and images. 
- Wait. It’s called ‘Landscape?’ :deepthink:

We strapped on some rocket boosters and improved the crap out of the iOS app. Here’s what we changed:

- Ton of performance improvements - everything from switching servers, interacting with the chat itself, and overall less CPU.
- Discord now uses less of your battery.
- The app loads faster so you can hop in and out like a bunny. Bunnys hop. This metaphor works.
- Discord now uses less data because we made the bits work better (better data compression).
- Fixed some silly voice engine crashes when the app was backgrounded. We’re very serious around here. No silliness.
- No more robo voice on iPhone 8/8+ unless you get one of those retro Darth Vader masks and speak through it.
- Fixed very specific issue where audio would stop while A) iOS device was asleep and B) during a bluetooth call.
- We found the missing audio route selector button on iOS 11. It’s there now.
- Fixed another silly crash from a call related push notification. 
- We’ve bargained with Zephyrus, so uploading images from iCloud should work now.
- Autocomplete suggestions will no longer get stuck above the keyboard and be really annoying.
- And on the seventh day, the Lord said “opening the user menu shall not crash.”
- The keyboard was gettin’ uppity sometimes and sliding out when it wasn’t wanted. We’ve put it back in it’s place.
- Fixed an issue where doing a drag maneuver on a link opened up the link to the dismay of everyone involved… which was probably just you. But you’re important!

- Fixed some silly voice engine crashes when the app was backgrounded. We’re very serious around here. No silliness.
- No more robo voice on iPhone 8/8+ unless you get one of those retro Darth Vader masks and speak through it.
- Fixed very specific issue where audio would stop while A) iOS device was asleep and B) during a bluetooth call.
- We found the missing audio route selector button on iOS 11. It’s there now.
- Fixed another silly crash from a call related push notification. 
- We’ve bargained with Zephyrus, so uploading images from iCloud should work now.
- Autocomplete suggestions will no longer get stuck above the keyboard and be really annoying.
- And on the seventh day, the Lord said “opening the user menu shall not crash.”
- The keyboard was gettin’ uppity sometimes and sliding out when it wasn’t wanted. We’ve put it back in it’s place.
- Fixed an issue where doing a drag maneuver on a link opened up the link to the dismay of everyone involved… which was probably just you. But you’re important!
- Fixed the bug where will get stuck when trying to logout.

- Video chat is now available! Show your face pixels to your friends' eye pixels while using Discord on the go, your uncle's couch, or that new Snorlax bean bag chair you love so much.
- We did some code jiu-jitsu so that Discord peeps who only use text won't have to initialize our voice stuff unless they connect to voice. Translation: less battery usage, less crashes, more fast.
- No more ghost group DMs during certain spooky situations when friend requests are accepted.
- The search drop down won't be coy when you use the 'from' tag in search.
- Friend suggestions now have a cute little icon showing you which platform they're from.
- iPhone X should now properly show the channel list without having to wave a magic wand and wish for them to appear.

NEW STUFF
- Animated Emoji are now supported! Move and groove your emotional mood.
- We did some heavy construction work and rebuilt the foundation of our chat. Now it’s better, you’re welcome.
- We added a little welcome message to the beginning of text chats so that you feel slightly more at home!


FIXED STUFF
- Tapping links in an embed description now properly open the link in your browser.
- Lower the anchor! Chat position will no longer jump around when new messages come in.
- Raise the anchor! Sending a message or file while scrolled up will return you to the bottom of the chat.
- Rich embeds that shouldn’t be hyperlinks no longer look like hyperlinks. Can’t fool me!!! HAHAHA

- The blight is spreading. Even more screens now respect dark theme.
- We've updated our codec to Opus 1.2! Experience the audio experience better than you've ever experienced it before.
- You can now switch between bluetooth and speaker during a call instead of not being able to do this.
- Tapping someone who’s actively streaming used to crash the app. We decided this isn't healthy and removed this crash. We hope you understand.
- Fixed some issues with rich embeds not richly embedding things. These jokes are all the same, I’m sorry.
- Fixed some crashes in search. Less chance for crash.
- Most importantly, fixed an egregious issue where selected servers remained circles instead of rounded squares. Designers across the world let out a resounding sigh of relief.

- iOS now has custom statuses. Let everyone know what's on your mind with a visible message on your profile.
- Faster navigation: A new layout for faster access to friends, quick switcher, and recent mentions. The quick switcher is also ... quicker.
- New confirmation feedback when you successfully copy links or send friend requests.
- Control your data usage: You can toggle to send lower quality images if on cellular data. To enable this, toggle in settings -> text & images.
- Fixed: Volume controls are no longer missing from the profiles of users in voice channels or calls.
- Fixed: Some other bugs around the app, including keyboard issues on the iPad.

• Servers now have their own snazzy profiles. Tap the server name at the top of the channel list to see a server's custom emojis and boosts.
• You can temporarily mute DMs, channels, and servers. 
• You can also now mark an entire server as 'Read' from the new server profile. 
• Sometimes, we all need a little quiet.
• We powered up the Member List: important options like Search, Mute, and Notification Settings are now easily available there.
• On the desktop or web version of Discord, you can seamlessly log in by scanning a QR code with your mobile device
• Server admins now have the power to disconnect users from voice channels.
• We added call rating! Every now and then, we'll ask for your feedback on call and voice quality, so that we can keep improving voice across the board.
• Fixed: Large gifs no longer crash the app. 
• Fixed: Before, if you got a call and your desktop app was open, your mobile app would forget to ring.  Now it remembers!

- Inviting people to calls and voice channels is easier now
- Voice channels are now in action sheets so you can hop in and hop out back to the rest of the app more easily
- We refreshed the emoji keyboard so you have more space to look at all your awesome artisanal emojis
- You can now follow Announcement Channels of your favorite servers on iOS
- You can now purchase and send gifts of Nitro
- Fixed a few bugs that makes us ready for iOS 13

- Upgraded our image picker. You can now multi-select pictures easily, and videos can be uploaded directly from our picker without going into your camera roll. Send pet pictures in your server's mandatory pet channel faster than ever.

- Making direct calls or group calls has a new look! You can now see a user's voice activity in a group call. Gather around to discuss said adorable pet pictures faster than ever.

- Fixed a bug where voice channels were missing the "read channel" permission. 

- Please send pet pictures to us on Twitter @discordapp
WE HEAR YOU. SERVER FOLDERS.

Bug Beatdowns

- Fixed a feature bug where swiping out of a server or DM back to the server list caused the app to bust out some sick dance moves. 

Video Vitalizations

- Added a speaker to non-speaker toggle button in voice channels. Was previously only available in individual and group DMs. 
- Voice calls in speaker mode no longer hang up when you lock your screen. That was rude of us.

Performance Buff

- We've sped up the app to load even faster. There's also a fresh new look for Clyde, your favorite spinning logo.

* Added in-line playback of uploaded videos and some videos from social media embeds. Double check you're sending the right video before disaster strikes. 

* Long-pressing a message will open an easier-to-read context menu. We've added quick access reactions, icons for clarity, and please go look I'm very excited about this.

* Tapping avatars will open the user menu as 10 years of internet habits says it should.

* Voice activity in channel lists is now viewable when channel categories are collapsed. Don't miss out on all those memorable voice sessions that you can't join anyway because you're in class. Pay attention, friend.

- We've done a ton of optimization on the app so it now loads faster than a high-speed turbo throttled express fast moving super sonic speedy quick accelerated rapid racecar.

- Nyoom.

- Zoom.

What's new:

- You can now toggle between speaker and non-speaker mode in DM/GDM calls. Let the world hear you...or not. Your call. 

- We shed some more weight on initial app load so the app should cold start even faster now. 

What will no longer bother you:

- We squashed the GIF autoplay bug that was causing the app to crash. 

- iOS 10 users can now accept incoming calls via PushKit.

- iOS Account Settings now has full parity with the desktop app. Delete your account, enable/disable 2FA, and change your discriminator numbers all while sitting on your phone despite being at your desk directly in front of your PC. This is a callout to myself.
- Added a fancy, in-line upload progress indicator for attachments. No more wondering if your images got lost in the void. We brought the void to you.
- Thai and Vietnamese are now supported! Next stop: Simlish. Benzi chibna looble bazebni gweb.
- Fixed a bug where fresh app installs messed with invite codes.  Step into a new server from your freshly-installed app like leaving that first footprint the morning after a snowstorm. *cronch*

- Discord now caches your last session. View your last visited channel and navigate in the app before fully connected. Things just got a whole lot faster.
- GIFV autoplay now supported. Is it pronounced GIF-Vh or GIF-Vee? Don't get me started on how to pronounce the G.
- And a whole lot data-save-y-er. You can now turn off GIFV autoplay in settings. We respect you and your limited data.
- And a whole lot prettier. Activity Feed news cards now mirror the desktop look.

- You can now hide message content behind a Spoiler, like ||this||. Loose lips sink ships, so keep your Discord ship afloat with a Spoiler tag.
- Fixes the chat crash of the malformed GIF.

**UPDATES** Fixed constantly reconnecting issues in voice chat and more voice bug fixes when app going to background.

- Two major voice engine crashes have been conquered. Long live voice chat!
- Untangled some wires that caused you to not hear audio when joining a channel while muted. 
- The dark side has completely and entirely consumed the iOS app. And by that, I mean the app is now 100% themed whether you’re on light or dark theme.
- Discord can now tell the difference between two or more channels with the same name when you wanna link to them (#whytho and #whytho). It’s hard raising twins.
- Server owners and group DM now show a crown next to their name so you know who the server or group DM owner is. Functional *and* stylish.
- Fixed a crash that happened when deleting a message. Crazy stuff happens when you try to TURN BACK TIME. 
- Channel icons will now show what kind of channel it is so you know what you're getting into (NSFW) or not getting into (private).
- The move member permission now works.

So hot right now:
- Discord is now a share option in the iOS share into menu because sharing is caring and we care about you, bb.
- Discord now remembers what server and channel you were last viewing when you reopen the app. It’s like saving your game except Discord is not a video game and I’m too tired to think of a good metaphor.
- We now show you an instant invite after you make a server so you can invite friends faster than Scorpion can say “get over here.”
- We now use revolutionary PNG technology instead of JPG, so you’ll see fewer broken avatars and server icons.
- Added the Verified Server icon because it should be there.
- More parts of the app now respect your theme choice. 

These bugs got slapped:
- Fixed an issue with text channel links that were unable to be tapped upon. Tapping shall commence once again.
- Our internal ghost hunters fixed an issue where invites to voice channels would create “ghost” text channels. Finally earning their keep, I guess. I just wish they didn’t smell like warm butter and fresh mulch. The real question is when to kill a joke. I’d say, now is a good time.
- Fixed a strange issue where blocking someone broke swiping around the app. 
- Cleaned up a crash where tapping someone somewhere when something wasn’t loaded sometimes didn’t like that and blew up. Less blewing up.

- iOS now has custom statuses. Let everyone know what's on your mind with a visible message on your profile.
- Faster navigation: A new layout for faster access to friends, quick switcher, and recent mentions. The quick switcher is also ... quicker.
- New confirmation feedback when you successfully copy links or send friend requests.
- Control your data usage: You can toggle to send lower quality images if on cellular data. To enable this, toggle in settings -> text & images.
- Fixed: Volume controls are no longer missing from the profiles of users in voice channels or calls.
- Fixed: Some other bugs around the app, including keyboard issues on the iPad.

• Servers now have their own snazzy profiles. Tap the server name at the top of the channel list to see a server's custom emojis and boosts.
• You can temporarily mute DMs, channels, and servers. 
• You can also now mark an entire server as 'Read' from the new server profile. 
• Sometimes, we all need a little quiet.
• We powered up the Member List: important options like Search, Mute, and Notification Settings are now easily available there.
• On the desktop or web version of Discord, you can seamlessly log in by scanning a QR code with your mobile device
• Server admins now have the power to disconnect users from voice channels.
• We added call rating! Every now and then, we'll ask for your feedback on call and voice quality, so that we can keep improving voice across the board.
• Fixed: Large gifs no longer crash the app. 
• Fixed: Before, if you got a call and your desktop app was open, your mobile app would forget to ring.  Now it remembers!

- Inviting people to calls and voice channels is easier now
- Voice channels are now in action sheets so you can hop in and hop out back to the rest of the app more easily
- We refreshed the emoji keyboard so you have more space to look at all your awesome artisanal emojis
- You can now follow Announcement Channels of your favorite servers on iOS
- You can now purchase and send gifts of Nitro
- Fixed a few bugs that makes us ready for iOS 13

- Upgraded our image picker. You can now multi-select pictures easily, and videos can be uploaded directly from our picker without going into your camera roll. Send pet pictures in your server's mandatory pet channel faster than ever.

- Making direct calls or group calls has a new look! You can now see a user's voice activity in a group call. Gather around to discuss said adorable pet pictures faster than ever.

- Fixed a bug where voice channels were missing the "read channel" permission. 

- Please send pet pictures to us on Twitter @discordapp
WE HEAR YOU. SERVER FOLDERS.

Bug Beatdowns

- Fixed a feature bug where swiping out of a server or DM back to the server list caused the app to bust out some sick dance moves. 

Video Vitalizations

- Added a speaker to non-speaker toggle button in voice channels. Was previously only available in individual and group DMs. 
- Voice calls in speaker mode no longer hang up when you lock your screen. That was rude of us.

Performance Buff

- We've sped up the app to load even faster. There's also a fresh new look for Clyde, your favorite spinning logo.

* Added in-line playback of uploaded videos and some videos from social media embeds. Double check you're sending the right video before disaster strikes. 

* Long-pressing a message will open an easier-to-read context menu. We've added quick access reactions, icons for clarity, and please go look I'm very excited about this.

* Tapping avatars will open the user menu as 10 years of internet habits says it should.

* Voice activity in channel lists is now viewable when channel categories are collapsed. Don't miss out on all those memorable voice sessions that you can't join anyway because you're in class. Pay attention, friend.

- We've done a ton of optimization on the app so it now loads faster than a high-speed turbo throttled express fast moving super sonic speedy quick accelerated rapid racecar.

- Nyoom.

- Zoom.

What's new:

- You can now toggle between speaker and non-speaker mode in DM/GDM calls. Let the world hear you...or not. Your call. 

- We shed some more weight on initial app load so the app should cold start even faster now. 

What will no longer bother you:

- We squashed the GIF autoplay bug that was causing the app to crash. 

- iOS 10 users can now accept incoming calls via PushKit.

- iOS Account Settings now has full parity with the desktop app. Delete your account, enable/disable 2FA, and change your discriminator numbers all while sitting on your phone despite being at your desk directly in front of your PC. This is a callout to myself.
- Added a fancy, in-line upload progress indicator for attachments. No more wondering if your images got lost in the void. We brought the void to you.
- Thai and Vietnamese are now supported! Next stop: Simlish. Benzi chibna looble bazebni gweb.
- Fixed a bug where fresh app installs messed with invite codes.  Step into a new server from your freshly-installed app like leaving that first footprint the morning after a snowstorm. *cronch*

- Discord now caches your last session. View your last visited channel and navigate in the app before fully connected. Things just got a whole lot faster.
- GIFV autoplay now supported. Is it pronounced GIF-Vh or GIF-Vee? Don't get me started on how to pronounce the G.
- And a whole lot data-save-y-er. You can now turn off GIFV autoplay in settings. We respect you and your limited data.
- And a whole lot prettier. Activity Feed news cards now mirror the desktop look.

- You can now hide message content behind a Spoiler, like ||this||. Loose lips sink ships, so keep your Discord ship afloat with a Spoiler tag.
- Fixes the chat crash of the malformed GIF.

**UPDATES** Fixed constantly reconnecting issues in voice chat and more voice bug fixes when app going to background.

- Two major voice engine crashes have been conquered. Long live voice chat!
- Untangled some wires that caused you to not hear audio when joining a channel while muted. 
- The dark side has completely and entirely consumed the iOS app. And by that, I mean the app is now 100% themed whether you’re on light or dark theme.
- Discord can now tell the difference between two or more channels with the same name when you wanna link to them (#whytho and #whytho). It’s hard raising twins.
- Server owners and group DM now show a crown next to their name so you know who the server or group DM owner is. Functional *and* stylish.
- Fixed a crash that happened when deleting a message. Crazy stuff happens when you try to TURN BACK TIME. 
- Channel icons will now show what kind of channel it is so you know what you're getting into (NSFW) or not getting into (private).
- The move member permission now works.

Words:
- Discord now opens links right inside itself using your default browser. NEVER LEAVE ME.
- So, hold on. Can you open a Discord link inside the browser? And then open a link inside that Discord instance which is an instance inside the initial link you tapped on from your original Discord instance? I think we’ve stumbled onto an awesome movie concept. Someone send Christopher Nolan a DM.
- Moving on, we’ve upgraded WebRTC and improved performance/infrastructure which means everything gets a little bit more buttery. Now, hand me some paper towels.
- At long last - you can now manage your connections settings on mobile. You guys have been waiting for this… right?
- Continuing with the shadowy consumption of all screens, the change nickname screen now respects your theme selection.

More Words:
- Large video files no longer make the iOS share menu cry and run away (crash).
- Instant invites with /invite will properly teleport you to the server you’re trying to access.

- Discord can now tell the difference between two or more channels with the same name when you wanna link to them (#whytho and #whytho). It’s hard raising twins.
- Server owners and group DM now show a crown next to their name so you know who the server or group DM owner is. Functional *and* stylish.
- Fixed a crash that happened when deleting a message. Crazy stuff happens when you try to TURN BACK TIME. 
- Channel icons will now show what kind of channel it is so you know what you're getting into (NSFW) or not getting into (private).
- The move member permission now works.

- Fixed constantly reconnecting issues in voice chat and more voice bug fixes when app going to background.

BETTER UNDER PRESSURE
- We did some heavy tinkering on Discord's core infrastructure. All the bullets in this section are related to this.
- Large servers perform better in general. CPU and network usage is about the same regardless of server size (whether a hundred people or a hundred thousand people).
- This means Discord uses a lot less data now. Long live your data plan.
- This also means Discord uses a lot less battery now. Longer live your battery life. Also, the iOS app loads faster.
- Large Discord servers can now grow much larger. This one's for you, Fortnite.
- Offline members are no longer hidden after you cross one-hundred members. We turned this off long ago for tech... and it is back. Offline lists in large servers are still hidden, though.

GOTTA GO FAST
- SLOW SUCKS, so quickly switch between servers, DMs, and channels with the all new and literally named Quick Switcher.
- Invite links now embed super cozy like a California king.
- Password Manager support on login for that easy yet secure access.
- You can now long press to copy links. **Long** awaited, amirite!?!?!??!!!!!
- Xbox users can now connect their Xbox account to Discord to show what game they're playing on Xbox in Discord.
- Invite links to voice channels now take you to the appropriate voice channel HOW CONVENIENT.
- NSFW channel toggle is now available in channel settings.

- Group DM invites will embed in chat with a HOT NEW LOOK. Hot new looks are so in right now.
- The sign in screen will now show if you were invited through a Group DM so you know where you’re going. It’s like a map with only the destination very useful.
- The bar where you type words before sending them out into the world has an imperceivable HOT NEW LOOK. It’s hard to tell but trust us it’s better. 
- The typing indicator will no longer hog the bed and push the chat bar up. I don’t really understand how the typing indicator would start on one side of the bed and go on some sort of odyssey to cross the great seas and move me so far that I’m literally free falling off the otherside into a puddle of floor smh. Glad it’s fixed.
- Autocomplete went through some self-help program, check it out:
- Autocomplete is no longer socially awkward and will leave instead of sticking around on screen sometimes.
- Autocomplete did hella push ups and is now bigger so it’s easier to tap on.
- Autocomplete animation is polished so that it can slide both up AND down. Multi Directional sliding!? That’s intense self-improvement.
- Fun fact, Discord has humans that build this mobile app. Come join our group of humans! Apply at https://discordapp.com/jobs maybe one day the app store will allow hyperlinks :^)

- You can now paste images into chat. If an image is worth a thousand words, you can now paste one thousand words into chat. If only you could post two or more pictures -- that’d be insane.
- Holy moly they did it. You can now post two or more pictures at once. 
- Discord’s font just completed some hot yoga and will now scale based on your iOS system settings. It’s a good stretch.
- The chat view now shows these cool like fake blob things so Discord looks less sad when things are loading :^)
- Tapping a friend request push notification will now open the profile for that user so you can inspect before you accept or reject.

- You can now add nearby people as friends with the power of WiFi and Bluetooth. Open the Add Friends screen and turn on the Nearby feature by tapping Find Friends. Stand near your IRL friend who also has this screen open and wait for them to magically appear on your screen. Keep the screen open otherwise the feature turns off.
- Autocomplete is now better at autopomcleting!
- The reactions pop-up underwent some performance improvements for those in servers with a million custom emoji.
- Quickswitcher now shows results properly. We've calmed the sickness that comes with the quickness.

SLOW IT DOWN
* **Chill things out with Slow Mode.** Enabled, users will only be able to send messages every N seconds. Chaos control.
* **Message grouping is now in seven minute intervals** instead of every hour. This will make it clearer when you have larger time frames between sequential messages.
* **You can now paste GIFs into the text input** so you can better compose whatever unfunny thing you're trying to post.
* **Retina images render at higher pixel density now** rather than being rendered at peasant density.

FIX IT UP
* **Fixed a crash** when pruning large guilds and when voice chatting with Discord in the background. To be clear, less crashing is good.
* **Group DM icon was positioned badly** and we removed the badly.
* **Fixed a loading issue with settings.** They load now. I'm running out of ideas. 
* **Nearby Friends** is no longer an entitled and ungrateful brat. Will not ask you for bluetooth access after you already gave it once. 
* **Nearby Friends** will also no longer attempt to search with wifi off. What a weirdo.
* **Hey guess what NEARBY FRIENDS AGAIN.** Wumpus animation is cleaned up a bit. 
* **No more ghost messages** reappearing in your text bar after you sent them. Way too spooky to keep in the app.

- Discord now caches your last session. View your last visited channel and navigate in the app before fully connected. Things just got a whole lot faster.
- GIFV autoplay now supported. Is it pronounced GIF-Vh or GIF-Vee? Don't get me started on how to pronounce the G.
- And a whole lot data-save-y-er. You can now turn off GIFV autoplay in settings. We respect you and your limited data.
- And a whole lot prettier. Activity Feed news cards now mirror the desktop look.

* **Nitro purchasing on mobile is finally here.** Customize your profile with a unique number and animated icon, get access to bigger file uploads and animated emoji, and use any emoji in any server all from your phone. * **Battery drain no longer occurs with GIFV autoplay.** Sprung a leak. Just placed the last piece of tape. You can take your floaties off now.

What's new:

- Viewing embedded images and GIFs is now more pleasant; a cleaner look with added performance buffs
- New updated UI for channel list colors for easy-on-the-eyes accessibility
- More touch feedback was added on things like message long press
- All sounds from desktop now play on your phone such as joining voice channels or Push to Talk
- Messages now load faster as you scroll through history

This update also squashes more bugs than you tryna pay off your debt in Animal Crossing:

- CallKit properly tracks time on call for outgoing calls
- Fixed Font scaling for channel list. Discord now matches font settings on your phone.
- “Unread messages since” should no longer get stuck when coming back from background
- Voice channels should now properly update their height when people join/leave
- Picking up call in background now always has audio
- Video flickering when toggle mute is fixed

That's gotta be at least 50,000 Bells.

What's new:

- You can now toggle between speaker and non-speaker mode in DM/GDM calls. Let the world hear you...or not. Your call. 

- We shed some more weight on initial app load so the app should cold start even faster now. 

What will no longer bother you:

- We squashed the GIF autoplay bug that was causing the app to crash. 

- iOS 10 users can now accept incoming calls via PushKit.

Video Vitalizations

- Added a speaker to non-speaker toggle button in voice channels. Was previously only available in individual and group DMs. 
- Voice calls in speaker mode no longer hang up when you lock your screen. That was rude of us.

Performance Buff

- We've sped up the app to load even faster. There's also a fresh new look for Clyde, your favorite spinning logo.

Build 'Em Up

- Uploading videos is now as easy as uploading images. We've removed the unnecessary steps like a construction worker that hates stairs.
- Users who join a server with a time limit enabled before they can send a message now receive a push notification when the timer ends. 

Break 'Em Down

- Fixed iPad screen orientation bug where the members list wouldn't open if the app opened on a rotation. Open us in portrait, landscape, or portraitscape. Landtrait? We can handle it all.
- Fixed occasional crash when leaving or backgrounding voice calls. Occasional crash is never a good pair of words.

- iOS now has custom statuses. Let everyone know what's on your mind with a visible message on your profile.
- Faster navigation: A new layout for faster access to friends, quick switcher, and recent mentions. The quick switcher is also ... quicker.
- New confirmation feedback when you successfully copy links or send friend requests.
- Control your data usage: You can toggle to send lower quality images if on cellular data. To enable this, toggle in settings -> text & images.
- Fixed: Volume controls are no longer missing from the profiles of users in voice channels or calls.
- Fixed: Some other bugs around the app, including keyboard issues on the iPad.

- Faster navigation: A new layout for faster access to friends, quick switcher, and recent mentions. The quick switcher is also ... quicker.
- New confirmation feedback when you successfully copy links or send friend requests.
- Control your data usage: You can toggle to send lower quality images if on cellular data. To enable this, toggle in settings -> text & images.
- Fixed: Volume controls are no longer missing from the profiles of users in voice channels or calls.
- Fixed: Some other bugs around the app, including keyboard issues on the iPad.

- Added Discord System Messages! These are official messages that we send to alert you of an account issue (e.g. payment issues, support ticket updates, and ToS violation warnings).
- Added a shortcut for changing your status: try long-pressing your avatar in the bottom tabs bar.
- Fixed: Receiving a call while outside the app will now reliably ring for you.
- Fixed: Captcha verification on iPad should no longer hang off the screen.
- Fixed: Status bar is no longer invisible on Light Theme.

• Servers now have their own snazzy profiles. Tap the server name at the top of the channel list to see a server's custom emojis and boosts.
• You can temporarily mute DMs, channels, and servers. 
• You can also now mark an entire server as 'Read' from the new server profile. 
• Sometimes, we all need a little quiet.
• We powered up the Member List: important options like Search, Mute, and Notification Settings are now easily available there.
• On the desktop or web version of Discord, you can seamlessly log in by scanning a QR code with your mobile device
• Server admins now have the power to disconnect users from voice channels.
• We added call rating! Every now and then, we'll ask for your feedback on call and voice quality, so that we can keep improving voice across the board.
• Fixed: Large gifs no longer crash the app. 
• Fixed: Before, if you got a call and your desktop app was open, your mobile app would forget to ring.  Now it remembers!

- Added full light-theme support for the left panel menu in the apps.
- Added direct sharing on iOS 13+! Now you can shadow content directly into your most frequented Discord channels or friends (yes we added a toggle to disable it).
- Added proximity screen disabling when on voice calls (in human words, this means the screen now turns off if you hold the phone close to your ear :beep-boop:)
- Fixed a bug where disabling CallKit integration would comically still flicker the CallKit integration - whoops.
- Added jump to present message button in the chat - now you can scroll scroll scroll scroll scroll scroll.... and go back to the present.
- You can now copy, text and links within the search results screen - saved ya a click.
- Added quick message quoting and reply shortcuts across the apps!

Features:

* Added role ping permission for admins and mods, and added role ping muting. This was a long overdue request. Owners of servers can set who can ping roles, and users in those roles can choose to mute those pings. 
* New jump to present message button. You can scroll back as far as you’d like without feeling like you have to break a finger to get back to the current conversation. 
* Your screen now shuts off if you bring the phone to your ear while in a call. No more accidental earlobe mishaps. 
* Full light-theme support for the left panel menu. Our light theme users are a small but mighty group we want to support to the fullest; we’ll defend you from the non believers.
* Added direct sharing. Now you can send content and links directly to your most frequented Discord channels and DMs. You can turn this feature off at any time. 
* Jumping to pinned messages is easier. The pinned message message (?) now links to which message (??) was pinned. In other words, it’s way easier to tell what was pinned without having to open the pin drop down menu.
* Copy text and links directly from search results. Before, you had to jump back to the Mesozoic era to copy an old message. Now, just long press while in the search menu.
* Long press on a message to quote it. Quoted messages are copied into the chat box and add a ping for the person you’re quoting. Type out your response and hit enter. 
* You can now set your Discord app theme to Automatic, so that your app theme matches your phone’s system theme. Perfect for those day/night people. Visit User Settings > Appearance to adjust this setting. 

Patches:


* Fixed a bug where disabling Callkit integration would...still show Callkit integration. We tried.
* Fixed a bug where uploaded gifs were... not showing up as gifs. We’re really trying I swear.

New Features 

* An @everyone “Are you sure?” warning has been added. Followed by a letter sent to your house confirming that you’re sure that you must sign and send back to us before we let you ping.
* Bots can now be added in-app from a link. When adding a bot, click another OAuth2 link inside the app; you won’t get directed to a web browser anymore.

A Quick Note 

Last month, in response to COVID-19, we upped the Go Live viewer limit from 10 to 50 people. Many of you have been using Discord to keep in touch and continue your daily lives, and we want to make things a little less stressful for you. We’ll keep this limit change up while it’s most critically needed. Stay safe <3

We’ll keep this limit change up while it’s most critically needed. Stay safe <3

* Added video downloads. Which is something I just learned we didn’t have before. Discord is now out of the Dark Ages.
